website_summaries.verdict: This entry-level model lets you give poles a try without spending a fortune. Some move on to better poles; others keep this for years.
pros: Single aluminum pole adjusts from 26.5 to 54.5 inches
Cork handle and nylon strap help you keep your grip
Can take heavy use and abuse
cons: Shock absorbing mechanism is challenging to engage

customer_reviews.title: Will keep you balanced well built
customer_reviews.text: I use this pole quite a bit. Great on uneven services. Great to keep your balance on either side. I take it fishing for extra support in the park Good at the mall and it is well built. It is collapsible so not a hassle to put in your back seat. If you have any mobility issues or you just need the support. Works better than most wooden canes I've used. Easy to take every where. Easy to keep clean as well I recommend this pole you can take it everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Allon Shabazz

customer_reviews.title: Great walking pole.
customer_reviews.text: With my bad knee hiking is not only difficult and painful but can be dangerous. The Coleman Trekking pole was a great help! After our hike my knee didn't hurt and I felt reassured with each step that I was safe. In fact I beat my husband over the rocky terrain. Now my husband is thinking of purchasing a Coleman Trekking Pole!
customer_reviews.author: D L H

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Accidently Over-Extend the Length
customer_reviews.text: Great and value priced trekking pole. However, it is very easy to overextend the pole length and then the pole is forever useless. Yes, in the fine print of the hard-to-read directions is a statement about not over-extending. Yes, there is a mark on the shaft that says to STOP. But if someone else grabs the pole to use and over extends then the pole is forever locked in an unusable position. Poof! Surely, a fail- safe of some type could be built into the pole to prevent this. Until then, be very careful with adjusting the length of the pole!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: Huge difficulty in getting sections to extend or collapse when needed. I left it behind on our last trip because I couldn't collapse the sections to pack. I often couldn't get the sections to extend and be secure.
customer_reviews.author: birder

customer_reviews.title: Best trekking pole!
customer_reviews.text: this is a great trekking pole! it is my second Coleman pole, because I now need two poles - I have pretty bad balance issues, but with two poles I can walk safely on sidewalks, most level trails, and bike paths. I have to put up with the "where's the snow" comments, but thats OK. The height is adjustable on the Coleman, and it locks in place once you set it. The cork hand grip is comfortable, and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: EllieB

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and this looked like a great walking stick. However, it came with NO instructions, and when I extended the pole gently it came right out. I was never able to make it lock in place. I returned it and ordered another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was not comfortable walking with a cane so I opted for this ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem with my balance and am rehabilitating. I was not comfortable walking with a cane so I opted for this trekking pole. I love it for walking. The pole is light weight and easy to use on walks and provides me with enough stability. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William McLain

customer_reviews.title: Works good for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: Being elderly I bought this to take my daily walks in the woods with my dogs. I like it and it has worked well. It is lightweight and easy to adjust the height. I have just used the little foot the way it came and haven't tried the other options. I use the strap to hang it on a coat hook right by the back door so it is out of the way yet handy to grab as we go out.
customer_reviews.author: Creative Software Products, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Best tool for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Handy to help me up a hill or to cut down the spider webs on the trail. Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Josie Engle

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Stick
customer_reviews.text: This Coleman walking stick feels very comfortable to use on mountain trails as well as meadow paths. The built in shock absorber works well on steep rocky terrain where the pole must momentarily support one's full body weight. The grip is naturally comfortable formed cork. It is easily adjustable for length, and is very sturdy, able to handle my 190 pounds with no signs of ware or impending problems.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mohn

customer_reviews.title: Best Handle grips!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hiking, walking, climbing the bank to pull weeds!!
customer_reviews.author: 2dmfish

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly well-priced
customer_reviews.text: I've got Leki's and got these for my wife to see if she'd be comfortable using poles. These are just of amazing quality, especially considering the price differential between these and my Lekis. You can't really miss with these. Very strong and the adjustment and spring are the high quality you'd expect from Coleman. Very happy with this purchase. They've now been trail-tested over about 20 miles of fairly technical terrain and haven't disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amahuna

customer_reviews.title: Works, but adjustments are difficult
customer_reviews.text: Now that we have this pole adjusted to the correct length, it seems to be useful and well made. However, the initial adjustment is very difficult. The friction-fit plastic inserts that keep the poles at a certain length can be very difficult to undo. I supposed that's a good thing when it's finally set correctly. But we really had to fight with it out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stern

customer_reviews.title: I use this when needed in water, walking on ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this when needed in water, walking on beaches etc. as I have leg braces and use it for extra support.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn R

customer_reviews.title: Ideal assist
customer_reviews.text: This walking pole is ideal for my use. It extends to the desired length nearly instantly, with practically no effort. It stores in my Jeep easily and helps me over the rough spots while exploring the desert. The light weight makes it so much easier to handle than a similar length wooden walking stick one of the best buys I've made in a long time
customer_reviews.author: fast roy

customer_reviews.title: Love that is light weight and telescoping for when I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this for hiking in rocky bottom water in the Narrows in Utah. Love that is light weight and telescoping for when I'm packing it but not using it.
customer_reviews.author: library lady

customer_reviews.title: Great pole for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this pole for someone new to trekking poles. It is lightweight for its price range, although more experienced hikers may want something even lighter. Note: this is only ONE pole - if you want two poles, get the Coleman set of two trekking poles package, for less than the cost of two of these poles. If you are unsure whether to try trekking poles, and don't want to spend $75 on Black Diamonds, get these - you can always upgrade later if you really like them and want something super-lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: AH Adams

customer_reviews.title: One pole????
customer_reviews.text: Had no idea this was an order for one pole, not a pair. My bad for not reading the product information more carefully, but who would have thought you would get just one pole?
customer_reviews.author: Sara Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Great Pole for the Price
customer_reviews.text: There are cheaper poles out there, and lighter poles out there. But at this price point there's not a better one. I like these and have yet to have one fail. The grips feel good even after a day of walking and they collapse down easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great Trekking Pole....
customer_reviews.text: I like this one, because the one I got included a compass on the handle, and it is very sturdy and comfortable. Not like some of the cheapo poles I picked up at Sam's club years ago which collapsed on me in the wild. The coleman pole is my standard "go to" trekking pole at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Carlton Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I already had one of these and wanted a matched set. This one fit the bill and wasn't expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not happy the extension pole get stuck in the first use so I can not make small anymore
customer_reviews.author: Lilianne

customer_reviews.title: A steal!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price. Has already see its way through the hiking trails of a few state parks; no complaints here. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Xxhurley82xx

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. It could occasionally be hard to unscrew the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. It could occasionally be hard to unscrew the poles, but once locked in, they were solid. They extended long enough for my father to use comfortably, and he felt at ease on the longer hikes, not having to worry about his knee giving out.
customer_reviews.author: Rmm

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good! But blisters after a few hours.
customer_reviews.text: I do like this pole and how it "bounces" while on a certain setting. It allows less impact on my arms. However, the cork does cause some blisters after hours of hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i am glad i got it as i use it all the time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... 3 days after I place my order it was easy to adjust for height & was already assembled great ...
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived 3 days after I place my order it was easy to adjust for height & was already assembled great for when I'm walking in my development in case of a stray dog or unexpected situation it provides me that extra sense of safety .
customer_reviews.author: Devon1

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This little pole has climbed alot of hills with me. So far, its pretty sturdy. The only thing I am not a huge fan of, is how it twists to size it. I have some arthritis in my hands and so its very hard to get it tight. Not a biggie when I have someone around to help, but when I am out on my walks, I can't adjust it! Otherwise, its worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Montee

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Fast & Got What I Order~!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for my girlfriend’s father and he loves it! I would recommend this item to my families and friends; and would order from them again! Thank you again for everything!
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend them. They are relatively inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: The adjusting mechanism was inconsistent. It was often very difficult to unlock them in order to collapse them. At one point, I was to leave them behind because I couldn't collapse them to fit tin my suitcase, but one last, final attempt before boarding was successful. I would not recommend them. They are relatively inexpensive, but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Maura Bauersfeld

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been able to use them because of our rainy weather but think they will be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Simonpietri

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: A great, adjustable, shock absorbing comfortable pole. It's sturdy and I really like the cork handle - much better than any other handle that I've used.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I love this hiking/walking pole! The price was GREAT and it works GREAT. I especially like the shock-absorbing feature. The only minor drawback is that since I am 6'3", I have to put it on its longest setting. It would be nice if I could lengthen it another inch or two, but it works fine as is. If you're taller than 6'3" though, you're not going to be thrilled with this pole, but I'm not aware of anyone who makes a longer one. We tall folks are discriminated against in many areas of life this way :( As long as you're 6'2" or shorter, you will love this pole.
customer_reviews.author: BigBalla

customer_reviews.title: Info card doesn't match product
customer_reviews.text: Product has card attached with instructions for how to change tips. The standard tip listed on the card for use on level ground did not come with the pole. Really needed that. Heads up if you're considering this. Update: this thing broke on second use. I was able to get it back together but I'm not happy that I had to. Beware...
customer_reviews.author: Rocksister

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Trekking Pole
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value and great product. Easy to adjust and very sturdy. I like it so much I bought a second one later.
customer_reviews.author: DAVE H.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used this the day I got it. I went hiking for 5 miles and my knees and back thanked me for using these poles.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Trout Fisherman, Really helps having a third leg when ...
customer_reviews.text: Trout Fisherman, Really helps having a third leg when crossing fast moving cold water mountain streams. Purchased one for my friend that I fish with and he loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Ward

customer_reviews.title: Never cache without it
customer_reviews.text: Its gotten me through empty ditches and those filled with snow and up and down hills. Won't geo-cache without it now.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn S

customer_reviews.title: My sons found these very useful on a recent hiking trip
customer_reviews.text: My sons found these very useful on a recent hiking trip. They did comment though that they wished they each had two poles instead of one.
customer_reviews.author: KELLY STARMAN

customer_reviews.title: Always enjoyed our coleman products....camping through the years (since 1953)
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a stroke in March. He went from a walker, to a cane, and then to the Trekking pole. He has better control now. He has special shoes as well...with inserts...making me feeling more assured he won't be falling. It was his Neurologist who first suggested it...then the Therapist. lm (the wife)
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine W Meier

customer_reviews.title: It is good on the first try
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pole. So review maybe limited. I like the big foot of this pole in particular. It is big than others and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Qin Wang

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I like that it has two feet that you can use. I've had problems in the past with collapsible items collapsing when you don't want them too, but this stays put where you adjust it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Mapes

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Trekking Pole
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my Therapist and is working well for me. I use it to walk in the neighborhood and uneven ground.
customer_reviews.author: Bjm oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: Trekking Poles
customer_reviews.text: The poles are very light weight, nice cork hand grips..better than 'rubber' ones, and the 'feet' are just what I had been looking for! All in one nice package...and made in America!! The best part!!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Warkentin

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: The pole comes apart and the fasteners do not tighten. It is worthless since you cannot adjust the height.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Short

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, flimsy--would not trust it.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, flimsy. I would not trust it. Took it out of the package and extended the telescoping poles. Twisted the "locking" collars then put a LITTLE pressure on it. It collapsed! I was using a camera monopod as a hiking pole but wore out the tip. The monopod was MUCH sturdier! This is going straight back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: Great Poles
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used these on her hike to Machu Picchu and loved them. They were light and portable - her only comment was they are a little too tall for someone shorter.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Cable

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Really helps when I don't realize my age and want to Geo-cash with the younger group. Reduses the pressure off my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Williams

customer_reviews.title: Trekking Pole
customer_reviews.text: It was just what I needed. I did not need a cane; so this is very helpful in walking on non-level ground and when walking uphill.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Trecking Poles
customer_reviews.text: I use the two T poles when walking longer distances. I have a very bad back and two T Poles help my balance and support. I use a cane in the office and at home.
customer_reviews.author: Walter R Guggenheimer

customer_reviews.title: Broke.
customer_reviews.text: I had no need for it right after purchasing, but when I did get to it, it came apart and now will not lock when extended. I missed the return window so I will throw this out because its presence reminds me of my wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: NYCGram

customer_reviews.title: They are OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: They are defininately NOT Leki's but for the price they are OK. A bit heavy for packing if travelling but cheap enough to leave behind. A big downside is that you can't pull them apart if you want to ensure they go back together. There are no gradations either for adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: When hiking up and down steep grades, I use a wood staff that I've had for years and it helps the (old) knees. But I was heading to New Zealand and needed something that collapsed for traveling. This wasn't expensive and served my needs. It's a little flimsy, but it helped me along the hike.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Cook

customer_reviews.title: great walking pole
customer_reviews.text: this a great product to substitute for a walking cane for the elderly. It is adjustable , stylish enough and has a large foot to help with uneven roads and side walks. i will recomend this to any one.
customer_reviews.author: oldman

customer_reviews.title: Returned it. I need something I can carry, ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. I need something I can carry, in the event it's needed, but not open until it IS needed. This one is too difficult to open and adjust in that kind of situation.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Piznole
customer_reviews.text: This piznole is the dopest of the dope. The only thang that could make it better is if it had Captrain Picard on it. They should sell a special edition Star Trekking Pole that you could use to tots beat down Romulans.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew-O-Fish

customer_reviews.title: pulled out of pole
customer_reviews.text: when I first got this pole I was setting it up to go walking and the pole pulled off! now I can not get it back on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: horrible it was broken in the book -the parts didn't fit. wait of time and money. hate it . hate it , hate it!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Sharp

product_meta.title: Coleman Trekking Pole
product_meta.description: Walk in comfort on your next hike with a Coleman Trekking Pole. Use it when you need it and put it in your backpack when you don't. Its easy-carry, easy-store aluminum design easily extends from 27 to 53 in., and the contoured cork handle with adjustable nylon strap makes it the perfect walking companion. With interchangeable tips, it will get you through any terrain.
feature_bullets: Extending pole, telescopes from 27 in. to 53 in.
Contoured cork handle grip for comfort
Adjustable nylon strap for secure fit
Comfort-walk foot or tungsten carbide tips

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
